description: US efforts to curb the export of key technologies to China are hurting both economies and may prove counterproductive, according to Jia Qingguo, a prominent academic and standing committee member of Beijing’s top political advisory body.
title: US’s China Export Limits Hurt Both Nations, China Advisor Says

description: A New Jersey lawyer who became the state’s top federal prosecutor in 2021 testified that Senator Bob Menendez told him during a job interview that a friend had been indicted “unfairly” and he should review the case carefully if he got the position.
title: Bob Menendez Used Prosecutor’s Job Interview to Lobby for Friend

description: Today on the Big Take: The link between a 1990s New Zealand experiment and the Fed’s decision to keep rates at recent highs — and why that might be a mistake.
title: The ‘Tragedy’ If the Fed Is Targeting the Wrong Inflation Rate

description: A growing number of US adversaries, led by Russia, are looking to influence the 2024 presidential election through for-hire commercial firms and the use of generative artificial intelligence, American officials said Wednesday.
title: Russia Leads Adversaries Looking to Sway 2024 Election, US Warns

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, White House correspondent Michelle Jamrisko looks at how inflation and the Federal Reserve’s messaging is playing out for President Joe Biden. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Biden Gets Good and Bad News From Inflation Data and Fed Meeting

description: House Republicans voted Wednesday to hold Attorney General Merrick Garland in contempt of Congress, referring him to his own department for prosecution.
title: Attorney General Garland Held in Contempt of US Congress by GOP

description: South Africa’s top court dismissed an application filed by a party led by former President Jacob Zuma to interdict the nation’s parliament from convening on Friday on the grounds that it was improperly constituted.
title: South African Court Rejects Zuma Bid to Stop Parliament Sitting

description: President Javier Milei will meet face-to-face with the head of the International Monetary Fund on the sidelines of the Group of Seven summit in Italy this week as Argentina seeks fresh funds to eventually lift capital controls.
title: Milei to Meet IMF Chief During Argentina’s Push for New Program

description: Children in Gaza accounted for nearly 40% of minors killed in conflicts globally last year, according to an upcoming United Nations report on cases it says it has verified, casting blame on both Israel and Hamas for the surge in deaths.
title: Gaza Home to 40% of Minors Killed in Conflict Last Year, UN Says

description: Keir Starmer said he will put economic growth and wealth creation at the heart of Labour’s manifesto, as his poll-leading opposition party seeks to blunt Conservative attacks about tax before the UK election on July 4.
title: Starmer Promises Labour Focus on Wealth Creation to Blunt Tories

description: US President Joe Biden is stepping up tariffs on products from China in response to what American officials call unfair trade practices. After a review of the increased tariffs his predecessor, Donald Trump, imposed on Chinese imports, the Biden administration said in May that it would maintain those and add more of its own. Both administrations have justified the moves by saying China’s industrial and trade policies put US competitors at a disadvantage.
title: Why Biden Is Doubling Down on Trump’s China Tariffs

description: Group of Seven leaders are set to reach a political agreement to provide Ukraine with $50 billion of aid using the profits generated by frozen Russian sovereign assets, according to an Elysee official.
title: G-7 Leaders to Agree to Tap Frozen Russian Assets, France Says
China Is Key Driver of Kenya’s Debt Service Costs, Lawmakers Say

description: The White House declined to say if President Joe Biden would consider commuting the sentence of his son, Hunter Biden, after his conviction on three felony gun counts.
title: White House Doesn’t Say If Biden Would Commute Son’s Sentence

description: Tesla Inc. has asked the European Union to subject its electric vehicles to a lower tariff rate than other manufacturers shipping cars into the bloc from China, arguing that it’s benefitted from less substantial state support.
title: Tesla Presses EU for Lower Tariff on EVs Shipped in From China

description: The far-right National Rally party of Marine Le Pen would win the first round of the French legislative election with 31%, while President Emmanuel Macron’s party would come in third with 18%, according to a poll of voting intentions published on Wednesday.
title: Macron Group Has 18%, Le Pen Party 31% in Elabe Election Poll

description: President Javier Milei is pushing to get his signature omnibus reform package across the finish line in the Argentine Senate in a debate that began Wednesday morning, although its most important fiscal measures face strong opposition and hang by a thread.
title: Milei’s Signature Reforms at Risk in Tense Argentine Senate Vote

description: The leaders of France’s conservative Republicans agreed unanimously to expel their president, Eric Ciotti, after he announced a pact with the far right ahead of the snap legislative election.
title: French Conservatives Expel Leader After Makes Far-Right Pact

description: China’s new ambassador to Canada, Wang Di, has arrived in Ottawa amid a diplomatic chill between the two countries.
title: Canada Gets New Ambassador From China As Tensions Persist

description: Norway’s government held onto its stance on limiting executive pay in state-owned companies after some key firms refused caps.
title: Norway’s Government Embroiled in Clash Over CEO Salaries

description: The UK’s Labour Party has promised to remove private schools’ tax-exempt status. Here’s what that means for the sector.
title: Why the UK's Labour Opposition Wants to Add Tax to School Fees

description: Elon Musk’s X, the social media site formerly known as Twitter, has become more popular with conservative users and those who identify with the political right since Musk’s takeover in late 2022, according to a new Pew Research Center report.
title: Elon Musk Has Made X More Right-Leaning, Study Shows

description: Germany presented proposals to help address a shortage of armed-forces personnel that relies on recruits volunteering for service, part of a drive to expand the military triggered by Russia’s war on Ukraine.
title: Germany Unveils Plan to Plug Yawning Shortage in Troop Numbers

description: Slovak Prime Minister Robert Fico’s government approved heightened security measures nearly a month after an assassination attempt targeted the premier, including providing life-long protection to high-level officials and restricting protests near their homes.
title: Slovakia Restricts Protests, Boosts Security After Fico Shooting

description: Norway, a trailblazer in the uptake on plug-in vehicles, won’t join the EU’s increase in tariffs on Chinese electric cars, Finance Minister Trygve Slagsvold Vedum said.
title: EV Leader Norway Won’t Follow EU on Chinese Electric Car Tariffs

description: The US will send a second Patriot missile battery to Ukraine, people familiar with the matter said, after Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy appealed for more of the powerful air-defense system to protect against Russian attacks.
title: US Set to Send a Second Patriot Missile Battery to Ukraine

description: For two decades, a California law has helped workers sue the world’s biggest companies. Drivers for Uber Technologies Inc. won a $20 million settlement, Google employees secured $27 million over complaints of free-speech violations, and Walmart Inc. agreed to pay $65 million for allegedly not providing seating to their cashiers.
title: Gavin Newsom Wants to Curb a Labor Law That Cost Businesses $10 Billion

description: In the UK’s relations with the European Union, there’s nowhere to go but up, according to Greek Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis.
title: EU-UK Ties ‘Can Only Get Better’ Under Labour, Greek PM Says

description: The prospect of far-right parties impeding European Union efforts to fill an annual €500 billion ($538 billion) investment gap makes the pooling of capital markets even more imperative, according to Scope Ratings.
title: Far Right May Irk EU in €500 Billion Investment Push, Scope Says

description: Rishi Sunak said he went without “lots of things” including Sky TV as a child so his parents could pay for his private education, as the prime minister used a controversial campaign interview with ITV to try to respond to criticism he is out of touch with voters struggling with the cost of living.
title: Sunak Says Family Sacrificed Sky TV to Pay His School Fees

description: Group of Seven leaders will call on Hamas to accept the cease-fire deal outlined by US President Joe Biden, according to a draft statement seen by Bloomberg.
title: G-7 Leaders to Urge All Sides to Accept Biden’s Cease-Fire Deal

description: Greece plans to repay bailout loans worth a total of €8 billion ($8.6 billion) ahead of schedule, underscoring the country’s progress in recovering from the debt crisis, Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis said.
title: Greece Plans Early Repayment of €8 Billion in Bailout Loans

description: Elections to the European Parliament are often viewed as a low-stakes opportunity for voters to take a poke at their national leaders, rather than an indication of who they actually want in power. French President Emmanuel Macron has put that theory to the test in dramatic fashion, calling a snap parliamentary election after his centrist party was trounced by far-right foe Marine Le Pen’s National Rally in the European vote on June 9. It’s the first time this century that a French leader has bro
title: Here’s Why Snap Election in France Is a Big Macron Gamble

description: French President Emmanuel Macron said he won’t resign if his party suffers a poor result in a snap parliamentary election that begins at the end of the month.
title: Macron Won’t Quit If His Party Is Beaten in French Election

description: Leaders from the Group of Seven are set to announce plans for a group that will help coordinate the supply chain for semiconductors that are critical to the global economy.
title: G-7 to Set Up Semiconductor Group to Coordinate Supply Chains

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Italy’s Leader Confounds Allies and Foes Alike

description: As the opposition Labour Party prepares to unveil its UK election offer on Thursday, its wide lead over Prime Minister Rishi Sunak’s governing Conservatives is holding steady, according to Bloomberg’s poll of polls.
title: Labour Lead Steady Before Manifesto, Poll of Polls Shows

description: China said it was willing to work with India to improve relations and said their border disputes “should be handled properly,” the latest exchange between the two countries following Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s narrow third-term win.
title: China Willing To Improve Ties With India, Work On Border Dispute

description: The European Union will slap additional tariffs of as much as 38.1% on electric vehicles shipped from China as of next month, escalating a global trade war and upping the cost of selling cars in Europe for companies ranging from China’s BYD Co. to Tesla Inc.
title: EU to Impose Additional Tariffs on EV Imports From China

description: With just two days to go before South Africa’s parliament is due to convene to elect a new president, the makeup of the new administration remains unclear, with coalition talks between the main parties yet to be finalized.
title: South African Coalition Talks Drag On as Presidential Vote Looms

description: Mentre il primo ministro italiano è un astro in ascesa a livello internazionale, in Italia aleggiano problemi, fra alleati di cui non si fida e un’economia e casse pubbliche con i giorni contati
title: Gli universi di Giorgia Meloni stanno per collidere

description: Group of Seven leaders will call on China to stop enabling and sustaining Russia’s war against Ukraine, according to a draft statement seen by Bloomberg.
title: G-7 to Call on China to Stop Helping Russia’s War in Ukraine

description: Around 4 a.m. on March 26, the White House Situation Room notified Chief of Staff Jeff Zients that the unthinkable had happened: a container ship struck the Francis Scott Key Bridge, crashing a central highway artery into the bay and cutting off the Port of Baltimore, one of the largest shipping operations in the US.
title: Inside the White House Push to Reopen Baltimore’s Ship Channel

description: NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg agreed to guarantee that Hungary won’t have to take part in the military alliance’s deepening support for Ukraine, Prime Minister Viktor Orban said.
title: NATO Chief Agrees to Hungary’s Opt-Out from Ukraine Support

description: The European Commission is due to notify Chinese electric-vehicle manufacturers of provisional tariff levels Wednesday and companies could face additional levies of around 25%, European officials said.
title: European Officials Say China EV Tariffs May Be Around 25%

description: Ukraine disrupted the latest Russian missile and drone barrage overnight as Russian President Vladimir Putin’s forces separately trained in northwestern Russia to operate launchers able to fire tactical nuclear weapons, the next phase of its joint drills with ally Belarus.
title: Russian Missiles Target Ukraine Alongside Nuclear Weapon Drills

description: Two nights before Prime Minister Rishi Sunak surprised the UK by calling a snap election, crypto executives were sipping wine and eating canapes on a House of Commons terrace, part of a months-long bid to build stronger links with British lawmakers and power brokers.
title: Crypto Companies Sunak Tried to Woo Now Look to Starmer

description: France’s next government must quickly clarify its economic policy as investors rattled by snap elections sell the country’s debt and drive up borrowing costs, Bank of France Governor Francois Villeroy de Galhau said.
title: Next French Government Needs a Clear Fiscal Strategy, Villeroy Says

description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. said inflation continues to be the country’s “greatest problem” brought on by price gains across the world that’s beyond the government’s control.
title: Marcos Says Inflation Remains Philippines’ ‘Greatest Problem’

description: Britain’s economic recovery ground to a halt in the run-up to the general election, a setback for Prime Minister Rishi Sunak, who has campaigned on evidence the economy is turning the corner.
title: UK Economy Stalls as Rain Holds Back Retail and Construction

description: While the US and allies decry China’s industrial “overcapacity” and prepare to sharpen tariffs in response, those embracing links with the factory to the world are getting a hand in their efforts to tame inflation.
title: China Exports Deflation But US Isn’t Benefiting as Ties Weaken

description: Greece’s Prime Minister Kyriakos Mitsotakis said the political center held in the European Parliament elections and created momentum for change, dismissing concerns about an upswell of populism.
title: Greek PM Says Center Holding in EU Despite Far Right Gains

description: Thailand’s Constitutional Court will resume deliberations next week on a high-profile case that seeks the removal of Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin from power over allegations of ethical violations.
title: Thai Court Proceeds With Legal Challenge That Could Oust PM

description: Tokyo Governor Yuriko Koike said she would run for a third straight term as leader of the Japanese capital, setting up an unprecedented race between two women for one of the highest-profile positions in the country’s politics.
title: Tokyo Governor Koike Seeks Reelection to Set Up Unprecedented Race

description: South Korea was rocked by one of its strongest earthquake in years when a magnitude 4.8 temblor hit a southwestern region Wednesday, shaking buildings in Seoul some 200 kilometers (125 miles) north.
title: South Korea’s 4.8 Magnitude Quake Shakes Buildings in Seoul

description: Hong Kong canceled the passports of six UK-based activists including former lawmaker Nathan Law, in an unprecedented move as city officials continue their crackdown on dissent.
title: Hong Kong Cancels Six Activists’ Passports in Unprecedented Move

description: Europe is intensifying efforts to make it cheaper for banks to raise funding and offload risk to capital markets as a way to free up billions for defense and the green transition.
title: Europe Speeds Up Plan to Revive Asset-Backed Securities Market

description: The UK economy lost more than £257 billion ($327 billion) in potential output because of demotivated workers last year, adding to a productivity crisis that’s left the country falling behind other wealthy nations.
title: Britain’s ‘Quiet Quitters’ Are Costing the Economy £257 Billion

description: While the Italian prime minister’s star keeps rising internationally, problems lurk back home with allies she can’t quite trust and an economy operating on borrowed time.
title: Giorgia Meloni’s Worlds Are About to Collide

description: The urge to block the social media app is spreading. But there are better ways to protect democracy in an election year.
title: I Spent a Day Down TikTok’s Disinformation Rabbit Hole

description: Britain’s finance minister battles to avoid losing seat in new `Portillo moment’ on July 4.
title: A Backlash in the Tory Heartlands Risks Historic Defeat for Hunt

description: Bidhi Bhoma is deputy chief executive officer of Panmure Liberum, the investment bank created by the merger of Liberum and Panmure Gordon. The firm counts more than 200 listed companies as clients, and employed about 280 people across the UK and North America when it announced the deal.
title: Labour Tax Hikes Would Drive Clients Offshore, Says Top Banker

description: Australia is optimistic the nation’s wine trade with China will fully recover after sales surged following the end of punitive tariffs.
title: Australia Hopeful Wine Trade With China to Recover as Sales Jump

description: Myanmar’s growth is likely to stay weak in the current fiscal year as high food and fuel costs, a weakening local currency and a lack of dollars drag on the economy, the World Bank said in a new report on Wednesday.
title: Soaring Living Costs to Curb Myanmar’s Growth, World Bank Says

description: Foreigners have started trimming their underweight stance on Indian stocks as signs emerge that Prime Minister Narendra Modi will continue to pursue reforms even with the new coalition government.
title: Global Money Has Started Tiptoeing Back Into Indian Equities

description: Australia is realistic about the challenges in its diplomatic relationship with Beijing, Treasurer Jim Chalmers said, as the country prepares for the first visit by a Chinese premier in more than seven years.
title: Australia ‘Not Naive’ on China as Li Visit Looms, Chalmers Says

description: Chinese regulators are considering tougher restrictions on how banks sell financial products to the public, in a move that could cut off a major distribution channel for some of the nation’s largest hedge funds, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: China Weighs Ban on Bank Distribution of Hedge Fund Products

description: The International Monetary Fund expects China to reschedule payments on part of the $18 billion swap line that it has extended to Argentina, a key step that frees up cash amid President Javier Milei’s deep budget cuts and helps sustain the fund’s massive fiscal support program for the country.
title: IMF Expects China to Reschedule Billions in Argentina’s Debt
